llm.feedback: Remove the fifth, nonsensical line and keep only four mover lines. Re‑format each as **Up/Down | 3‑6 months | Driver (spx) | Watch: August payrolls, Fed minutes | Prob %** (e.g., “Up | 3‑6 months | Fed cut acceleration (spx) | Watch: August payrolls, Fed minutes | 35 % (FAN5RYW6T)(GK86UUQPN)”). Add the canonical handle **spx** in the driver to satisfy the mapping rule. For the trade plan, add a single swing‑trade line: **Down | 3‑6 months | Entry: 4.5 % below current | Stop: 5 % below current | Target: 6 % below current | R/R: 1:1 | Invalidation: Fed cut acceleration (spx) | Trigger: August payrolls weak (GK86UUQPN) | Prob 45 % | Conf 80**. Ensure all percentages are evidence‑based, cite IDs inline, and drop any non‑canonical references. This yields a concise, actionable 4‑line movers section plus a compliant swing‑trade plan.
